title: NRL Grand Final viewers slam OneRepublic's pre-game entertainment
text:
Viewers slammed NRL's Grand Final pre-game entertainment on Sunday night.

Taking to Twitter, football fans criticised American pop band OneRepublic's decision to cover Beyoncé's 2008 hit Halo.

'Really? A Queen Bey funeral song pre-game?' one viewer commented online.

Criticism: Viewers slammed NRL for their Grand Final pre-game entertainment on Twitter, as OneRepublic covered Beyoncé's 2008 hit Halo on Sunday night. Pictured: Ryan Tedder

Funeral song: 'Really? A Queen Bey funeral song pre-game?' one viewer asked on Twitter

'Why is Halo being sung as a cover at the NRL Grand Final?' another fan asked.

'OneRepublic's screaming cover of Beyoncé's Halo, while the choir try to cover up how bad he's singing, was the perfect choice to get the crowd pumped up for the #NRLGF well done NRL,' one wrote.

Some poked fun at the code's inability to secure Beyoncé for pre-game entertainment, sharing: 'When the #nrl wants to book Beyoncé but gets OneRepublic to perform Halo. Yuck.'

Second choice? Some poked fun at the code's inability to secure Beyoncé for pre-game entertainment

Harsh critique: One viewer suggested the staff of NRL should be 'sacked'

However it wasn't all negative, with select viewers praising OneRepublic for a stellar performance.

'Unpopular opinion on the Twitter verse right now, but OneRepublic actually doing a bl**dy good job,' one wrote. 'Not liking their music isn't a reason to slam them. Music is subjective.'

OneRepublic, comprising of lead vocalist Ryan Tedder, guitarists Zach Filkins and Drew Brown, basisst and cellist Brent Kutzle, drummer Eddie Fisher and keyboardist Brian Willett, took to the stage at Sydney's ANZ Stadium on Sunday night.

Hyped performance: OneRepublic, comprising of Ryan Tedder (pictured), Zach Filkins, Drew Brown, Brent Kutzle, Eddie Fisher and Brian Willett, took to the stage at Sydney's ANZ Stadium

Not holding back: Another football fan described the pre-game entertainment as a 'cringe competition'

The band sung Beyoncé's Halo as well as their own hits, Counting Stars and Something I Need.

The NRL Grand Final between the Sydney Roosters and Canberra Raiders is well underway in front of a sell-out crowd of more than 80,000 fans.

Earlier, thousands of die-hard Sydney Roosters and Canberra Raiders fans showed their true colours as they flocked to the packed Sydney Olympic Park precinct to cheer their teams on.

Songs: The band sung Beyoncé's Halo as well as their own hits, Counting Stars and Something I Need

Positivity: However it wasn't all negative, with select viewers praising OneRepublic for a stellar performance
description: Viewers slammed NRL's Grand Final pre-game entertainment on Sunday night, as American pop rock band OneRepublic performed a cover of Beyoncé's 2008 hit Halo.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
